SRP.Q: In the radar chart, what is the next dimension in the clockwise direction from Route Efficiency ?
SRP.A: The next dimension clockwise from Route Efficiency  is Fuel Cost as Rate of Revenue

SRP.Q: In the radar chart, what is the next dimension in the counterclockwise direction from Route Efficiency ?
SRP.A: The next dimension counterclockwise from Route Efficiency  is Route Optimization Efficiency.

SRP.Q: On the On-Time Delivery Rate , is the point for Skinner, Hernandez and Rodriguez inside or outside the point for Ramirez PLC?
SRP.A: On the On-Time Delivery Rate , the point for Skinner, Hernandez and Rodriguez is outside the point for Ramirez PLC.

VPR.Q: Which label encloses the largest score in the radar chart?
VPR.A: label {Fuel Cost as Rate of Revenue} encloses the largest score

VPR.Q: What are the strongest and weakest dimension of Skinner, Hernandez and Rodriguez?
VPR.A: The strongest aspect is {Fuel Cost as Rate of Revenue}, while the weakest aspect is{ Route Efficiency }.

VPR.Q: On dimension Route Optimization Efficiency, which label scores the highest?
VPR.A: On Route Optimization Efficiency, label {Skinner, Hernandez and Rodriguez} scores the highest.

VPR.Q: On dimension On-Time Delivery Rate , which label scores the highest?
VPR.A: On On-Time Delivery Rate , label {Ramirez PLC} scores the lowest.

VE.Q: What is the value of Ramirez PLC on the Route Efficiency  in the radar chart?
VE.A: The value of Ramirez PLC on the Safety dimension is {80}.

VE.Q: What is the value of Skinner, Hernandez and Rodriguez on the Route Optimization Efficiency in the radar chart?
VE.A: The value of Skinner, Hernandez and Rodriguez on the Safety dimension is {69}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value of label Skinner, Hernandez and Rodriguez across all dimensions in the radar chart?
EVJ.A: The maximum value of Skinner, Hernandez and Rodriguez across all dimensions is {70}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value of label Ramirez PLC across all dimensions in the radar chart?
EVJ.A: The minimum value of Ramirez PLC across all dimensions is {70}.

SC.Q: What is the average value of Route Optimization Efficiency
SC.A: The average value of Route Optimization Efficiency is {72.5}.

SC.Q: What is the average value of Skinner, Hernandez and Rodriguez

NC.Q: For Skinner, Hernandez and Rodriguez, which dimension has a higher score: Fuel Cost as Rate of Revenue or Route Optimization Efficiency?
NC.A: {Fuel Cost as Rate of Revenue} has a higher score than Route Optimization Efficiency for Skinner, Hernandez and Rodriguez.

NC.Q: On Route Efficiency , which label has a higher score: Skinner, Hernandez and Rodriguez or the Ramirez PLC?
NC.A: {Ramirez PLC} has a higher score on Route Efficiency  compared to Skinner, Hernandez and Rodriguez.

NC.Q: For Ramirez PLC, which dimension has a higher score: Route Optimization Efficiency or On-Time Delivery Rate  or Route Efficiency ?
NC.A: {Route Efficiency } has a higher score for Ramirez PLC.

NC.Q: For Skinner, Hernandez and Rodriguez, which dimension has a higher score: Service Coverage Rate or Route Optimization Efficiency or Fuel Cost as Rate of Revenue?
NC.A: {Fuel Cost as Rate of Revenue} has a higher score for Skinner, Hernandez and Rodriguez.

MSR.Q: For Ramirez PLC, based on the data shown in the radar chart, which dimension does it most need to improve?
MSR.A: Ramirez PLC most needs to improve its {On-Time Delivery Rate }.

MSR.Q: In the radar chart, which label has the strongest overall capability across all labels?
MSR.A: The label with the strongest overall capability is {Ramirez PLC}.

MSR.Q: In the radar chart, which label has the weaknest overall capability across all labels?
MSR.A: The label with the weaknest overall capability is {Skinner, Hernandez and Rodriguez}.
